author: Aya Wagatsuma, Mari Kiyohara
description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s plan to step down has investors scrambling to assess the implications for the nation’s stocks, government bonds and currency.
title: A Trader’s Guide to Candidates for Japan’s Prime Ministership

author: Fasika Tadesse, Simon Marks
description: Ethiopia on Tuesday will inaugurate Africa’s biggest hydroelectric dam, a colossal feat of engineering that could power homes and industries across East Africa, while deepening a years-long dispute with Egypt and Sudan over the Nile’s flow.
title: Africa’s Largest Dam Starts Powering Ethiopia Despite Egypt Row

author: Sarah Holder, Rachael Lewis-Krisky, Julia Weaver
description: Today on the Big Take: The Trump Administration says it’s cutting funding for climate science work to save money. But it could cost the US for decades.
title: The Economic Toll of Unwinding US Climate Science

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: US Food and Drug Administration Commissioner Marty Makary said the federal government has not yet started writing a report on the possible causes of autism but reaffirmed a longstanding promise that it will be released “within a month.”
title: FDA Head Says Government Hasn’t Started Writing Autism Report

author: Eliyahu Kamisher, Nathan Risser
description: Governor Gavin Newsom is seeking to impose further restrictions on California’s offshore oil industry, a setback to Sable Offshore Corp. and its controversial project off the coast of Santa Barbara County.
title: Newsom to Curb Offshore Oil in Exchange for More Onshore Output

author: Lucy White
description: Nigel Farage has only four members of Parliament and may have to wait until 2029 to have a shot at being prime minister. But his Reform UK is already trying to steer investors away from projects that don’t fit its populist agenda.
title: Reform UK Undermines Labour Agenda With Threat to Kill Projects

author: Nathan R Dean
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Neither Party Has a Strategy for a Government Shutdown

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: House Democrats on Monday released an alleged birthday note that they said Donald Trump sent to Jeffrey Epstein, raising pressure on the president over questions about his past interactions with the late disgraced financier.
title: Epstein Letter Allegedly From Trump Released by House Democrats

author: Mathieu Dion
description: Aluminum producers in Quebec are diverting more of the metal used to make cans and car parts to Europe as rising US tariffs make their shipments more expensive for American customers.
title: Canada Aluminum Hub Diverts Exports to Europe as US Tariffs Bite

author: Andreina Itriago
description: A top Venezuelan official warned “everything is fair game” after a US strike on an alleged drug boat killed 11 people last week.
title: Venezuela Says ‘Everything’s Fair Game’ After US Attack on Boat

author: Erin Ailworth
description: The Department of Homeland Security said it was stepping up immigration enforcement in Chicago and the rest of Illinois with Operation Midway Blitz, targeting people it described as “criminal illegal aliens.”
title: ICE Launches ‘Midway Blitz’ With Trump Threats Rattling Chicago

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: The US imposed sanctions on a network of cyber scam centers operating in Southeast Asia, a bid to heighten pressure on operations allegedly using forced labor to bilk billions from Americans annually.
title: Trump Targets Asian Cyber Scam Centers That Bilked Billions

author: Ott Ummelas
description: Norway’s Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store is on track for another four-year term in office after a close election where his Labor Party played to voters’ fears of uncertainty regarding taxation and welfare policies.
title: Norway’s Ruling Labor Party Set to Win Parliamentary Vote

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: White House economic adviser Stephen Miran’s nomination as a Federal Reserve governor has been scheduled for a Senate committee vote Wednesday, a move that could allow him to be confirmed by the full Senate before a pivotal September vote on cutting interest rates.
title: Senate Banking Panel to Vote on Miran Fed Nomination Wednesday

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Jessica Nix
description: President Donald Trump posted a video Monday of a scientist with ties to Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. falsely claiming vaccines contain toxic ingredients.
title: Trump Posts Video Claiming Vaccine Additive Thimerosal Is Toxic

author: William Horobin
description: French President Emmanuel Macron is seeking a fifth prime minister in less than two years to tackle the country’s debt problems and there are no obvious candidates with a decent chance of success.
title: Macron Is Running Out of Viable Prime Ministers for France

author: Samy Adghirni, William Horobin
description: French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou lost a confidence motion in parliament, forcing a third change in government in just over a year and reviving uncertainty over how the country can tackle its mounting debt burden.
title: French Premier Bayrou to Resign After Losing Confidence Vote

author: Courtney McBride, Jim Wyss
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth and Air Force General Dan Caine, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, made an unannounced visit to Puerto Rico on Monday as the US military ramps up its counter-narcotics efforts in the Caribbean.
title: Hegseth, Caine Visit Puerto Rico Amid Counternarcotics Push

author: Kamailoudini Tagba
description: Ivory Coast President Alassane Ouattara will face four candidates in next month’s election and appears to be a shoo-in to win after key opposition leaders were disqualified from running.
title: Ivorian Council Confirms Thiam, Gbagbo Exclusion From Election

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva decried the use of tariffs as a tool of “blackmail” while China’s Xi Jinping said trade wars were disrupting the global economy during a BRICS summit that took place against the backdrop of Donald Trump’s targeting of the bloc’s members.
title: Lula, Xi Decry Tariffs and Urge BRICS Unity Amid Trump Threats

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The US Army awarded contracts to a partnership of Anduril Industries Inc. and Meta Platforms Inc., and another led by Rivet Industries, to produce competing prototypes of a new combat goggle.
title: US Army Awards Combat Goggle Contracts to Anduril-META Team, Rivet

author: Sri Taylor
description: Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro on Monday directed the state’s Department of Transportation to approve a request directing a one-time funding lifeline to the cash-strapped mass transit system that serves the Philadelphia region.
title: Philadelphia Transit Hub to Get Funding Bailout to Reverse Cuts

author: Tom Rees
description: Britain’s embattled statistics agency faces the prospect of its staff extending their industrial action, a blow to its revamped management team, which is trying to stabilize the country’s economic data.
title: Staff at UK’s Troubled Stats Agency Look to Extend Work Showdown

author: Michelle Kaske
description: New York City’s police commissioner doesn’t want to see the National Guard patrolling the streets of the nation’s biggest city and is “revolted” by the prospect of President Donald Trump deploying the military to urban areas.
title: NYPD’s Tisch ‘Revolted’ by Idea of Federal Troops on NYC Streets

author: Lauren Dezenski, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said “many more” settlements with elite universities over civil rights claims were coming soon and warned that schools would face further scrutiny if they did not adhere to existing agreements.
title: Trump Predicts ‘Many More’ University Settlements Despite Harvard Ruling

author: Vidya N Root
description: Imposing heavy taxes on the rich won’t extricate France from its budget morass and would only push them to leave the country, according to French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou.
title: French PM Warns Against Overtaxing Rich Such As LVMH’s Arnault

author: Greg Stohr
description: US Chief Justice John Roberts let President Donald Trump temporarily oust a Democratic member of the Federal Trade Commission, signaling that the Supreme Court is likely to back Trump’s bid to assert control over the independent agency.
title: US Chief Justice Lets Trump Oust FTC Commissioner for Now

author: Bill Allison
description: When Donald Trump flew to the UK in late July for meetings with Prime Minister Keir Starmer and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, it was the US president who played host: The sessions were held at Trump Turnberry, his golf course on Scotland’s southwestern coast.
title: How Trump’s Business Empire Benefits From His Presidency

author: Samy Adghirni
description: Prime Minister Francois Bayrou emphasized the need to fix France’s fiscal problems ahead of a confidence vote later Monday that will likely lead to his government’s collapse.
title: French Premier Warns of Debt Crisis as Government Teeters

author: Arne Delfs
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz vowed to make it a priority for Germany to reduce its dependence on China for raw materials, warning that the government in Beijing is ready to “exploit trade vulnerabilities.”
title: Merz Warns China Ready to Exploit German ‘Trade Vulnerabilities’

author: Jonathan Tirone, Arsalan Shahla
description: Iranian nuclear sites face a higher probability of renewed military attack unless international inspectors are allowed to resume their work, the head of the United Nations atomic watchdog said, while suggesting a preliminary agreement could be getting closer.
title: Iran Runs Risk of More Military Attacks, Nuclear Watchdog Says

author: Ruth Carson, Matthew Burgess, Harry Suhartono, Grace Sihombing
description: The removal of Sri Mulyani Indrawati, a finance ministry veteran and an advocate for fiscal stability, risks raising market volatility.
title: Indonesian Minister’s Sudden Exit Sparks Alarm for Global Funds

author: Gaspard Sebag
description: Far-right leader Marine Le Pen faces a retrial starting in January next year as she seeks to overturn a conviction and election ban that is standing in the way of her plans to run in the next presidential race.
title: France’s Le Pen Faces Retrial in January to Topple Election Ban

description: Francois Bayrou Photographer: Nathan Laine/Bloomberg
title: French PM Bayrou Faces Confidence Vote

author: Ailbhe Rea
description: The UK’s governing Labour Party agreed a timetable for the election of a new deputy leader to replace Angela Rayner, firing the starting gun on a potentially destabilizing process for Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
title: UK Labour Party Agrees Timetable for Deputy Leadership Contest

author: Nancy Cook, Joshua Green
description: Scott Bessent is studiously trying to avoid the fate of the last Treasury secretary who picked a Fed chair for President Donald Trump and now finds himself banished from the inner circle.
title: Bessent Battles Trump Demands, Market Jitters in Fed Chair Hunt

author: Pius Lukong
description: The African Development Bank has approved the award of contracts to four Chinese companies to reconstruct a 278-kilometer highway in Cameroon’s north that’s vital for trade with neighboring Chad.
title: Chinese Firms Win Bid to Build Road Used for Cameroon-Chad Trade

author: Beril Akman, Selcan Hacaoglu
description: Turkish riot police used tear gas on protesters outside the main opposition party’s Istanbul headquarters on Monday, amid a mounting political standoff.
title: Turkish Police Fire Tear Gas Outside Opposition Headquarters

author: Alex Morales
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s government will seek to reverse a series of changes made to its flagship employment rights legislation when it returns to the House of Commons in coming weeks.
title: Starmer Seeks to Overturn Lords Changes to Workers’ Rights Bill

author: Andra Timu
description: A protest in Romania by striking teachers drew more than 10,000 people to the streets of the capital as the government confronts mounting social discontent over its agenda to cut state spending.
title: Romanian Teacher Protest Draws Thousands Over Austerity Agenda

author: Nicolle Yapur, Giovanna Bellotti Azevedo
description: Argentina’s currency, bonds and stocks plunged after President Javier Milei’s party suffered a landslide defeat in a key provincial election, heightening concern the administration lacks the political support needed to sustain its overhaul of the economy.
title: Argentina Assets Plunge as Buenos Aires Voters Rebuke Milei

author: Swati Gupta
description: At least fourteen people were killed and dozens injured in Nepal’s Kathmandu during protests against the government’s decision to ban several social media platforms, local media reported.
title: Nepal Sees Deadly Clashes as Protests Erupt on Social Media Ban

author: Andreo Calonzo
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said there’s no need to include flood control projects in the 2026 national budget, in the wake of corruption allegations in this type of infrastructure.
title: Philippines’ Marcos Wants to Remove Flood Control Funding in 2026 Budget

author: Galit Altstein
description: Israel and India announced the signing of a bilateral investment agreement by their finance ministers in New Delhi.
title: Israel and India Sign Agreement to Bolster Bilateral Investment

author: Augusta Saraiva
description: US job growth in the year through March was probably far less robust than government figures currently show, underscoring a labor market that shifted into a lower gear well before the hiring slowdown this summer.
title: Another US Jobs Markdown Sets Stage for Fed Cut, BLS Criticism

author: Patrick Gillespie
description: President promises self-reflection after setback in provincial vote while pledging to hold fast to his signature economic policies
title: Milei’s Surge Checked in Argentine Ballot Blow

author: Alisa Odenheimer
description: Israeli police and medics said five people were killed by a gun attack on a bus in Jerusalem.
title: Israel Says Five Killed in Shooting Attack on Jerusalem Bus

author: Chandra Asmara, Grace Sihombing
description: Indonesia has removed Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati from her post, a move that may plunge President Prabowo Subianto’s administration further into turmoil just days after violent demonstrations rocked the nation. Stocks and rupiah forwards erased earlier gains.
title: Indonesia Removes Sri Mulyani as Finance Minister After Protests

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan’s Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba announced on Sept. 7 he would resign, succumbing to weeks of pressure from within his ruling Liberal Democratic Party, following a historic upper house election loss in July.
title: Why Japan’s Prime Minister Is Resigning After Just a Year in Office

author: Gregory Korte
description: Americans’ positive image of capitalism has eroded over the past decade, as a new Gallup poll finds widening polarization over the US economic system.
title: Support for Capitalism Drops to New Low in US, Gallup Says

author: Andreo Calonzo
description: The Philippine Senate elected a new leader on Monday, more than a month after it shelved Vice President Sara Duterte’s impeachment case and as the chamber investigates corruption in flood control projects.
title: Philippine Senate Elects New Head as Corruption Scandal Builds

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union is exploring new sanctions on about half a dozen Russian banks and energy companies as part of its latest round of measures to pressure President Vladimir Putin to end the war against Ukraine.
title: EU Weighs New Sanctions on Russia to Hit Banks and Oil Trade

author: James Mayger, Erica Yokoyama
description: China has sanctioned a Japanese member of parliament for the first time, a move that may inflame ties with Tokyo.
title: Beijing Sanctions Japanese Lawmaker in First Over China Comments

author: Sakura Murakami, Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s ruling party faces a tough decision over its future as it searches for a new leader to replace outgoing Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba, stop the slide in its support at the polls and reassure investors.
title: Japan’s Ruling Party Faces Choice of Wooing Right or Rebranding

author: Chandra Asmara
description: A survey conducted shortly before Indonesia saw massive protests over lawmakers’ perks found a majority of people want an opposition presence in parliament, underscoring public unease about the dominance of President Prabowo Subianto’s coalition.
title: Indonesians Want Opposition Check on Prabowo Power, Survey Says

author: Ailbhe Rea
description: Tom Kibasi was seconded from NHS England to work on part of the government reboot and was expected to be involved for months.
title: Starmer Strategist Leaves Downing Street After Two Weeks

author: Alan Crawford, Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth
description: Arctic-power rivalry means Svalbard’s strategic importance is growing — but that can’t hide the Norwegian outpost’s identity crisis.
title: High in the Arctic, Norway’s Uneasy Ties With Russia Are Fraying

author: Samy Adghirni
description: Prime Minister Francois Bayrou’s government will likely fall Monday, a victim of his push to chip away at France’s massive debt load.
title: French Premier On Verge of Ouster Over Budget: What to Watch

author: Ott Ummelas, Kari Lundgren
description: New from Bloomberg: Get the Nordic Edition newsletter for sharp analysis and new perspectives on the forces shaping business and finance in the Nordic region.
title: Wealth Taxes and a $2 Trillion Fund: An Investor Guide to Norway’s Election

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Former Thai Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra is scheduled to return to Bangkok on Monday, days after his abrupt departure for Dubai stoked speculation about him fleeing the country ahead of a court ruling that could see him jailed.
title: Thaksin Flies to Singapore, Plans Return to Thailand for Ruling

author: Hyonhee Shin, Youkyung Lee, Yoolim Lee
description: South Korea’s biggest conglomerates are rushing to contain fallout from a sweeping US immigration raid at a Hyundai Motor Co.-LG Energy Solution Ltd. battery venture in Georgia, a move that threatens to disrupt the electric-vehicle supply chain and put billions of dollars in planned investments at risk.
title: South Korean Companies Reel From Fallout of Hyundai Plant Raid

author: Colum Murphy, Martha Viotti Beck
description: China has confirmed that President Xi Jinping will take part in a virtual BRICS summit convened by Brazil to discuss Donald Trump’s trade policy. India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi will skip the meeting but will send a senior representative instead.
title: Xi and Putin to Take Part in BRICS Trade Summit Without Modi

author: Andreina Itriago
description: Venezuela will increase security in four of its coastal states and one island amid rising tensions with the US over its recent deployment in the Caribbean.
title: Venezuela Boosts Security in Five States Amid US Threats
